trans-unit.source: Send a Command/Query to an Instrument/Device through the VISA interface (GPIB / TCP)

seg-source.mrk: Send a Command/Query to an Instrument/Device through the VISA interface (GPIB / TCP)

target.mrk: Send a Command/Query to an Instrument/Device through the VISA interface (GPIB / TCP)

trans-unit.source: A VISA descriptor (STRING) OR a VISA session handle (INTEGER)

seg-source.mrk: A VISA descriptor (STRING) OR a VISA session handle (INTEGER)

target.mrk: A VISA descriptor (STRING) OR a VISA session handle (INTEGER)

trans-unit.source: This it can be a string or an integer (a handle):

seg-source.mrk: This it can be a string or an integer (a handle):

target.mrk: This it can be a string or an integer (a handle):

trans-unit.source: * STRING -&gr; A VISA DESCRIPTOR is a string which specifies the resource with which to establish a communication session.

seg-source.mrk: * STRING -&gr; A VISA DESCRIPTOR is a string which specifies the resource with which to establish a communication session.

target.mrk: * STRING -&gr; A VISA DESCRIPTOR is a string which specifies the resource with which to establish a communication session.

trans-unit.source: This function supports all valid VISA descriptors, including GPIB, TCP, VXI and Serial Interface instruments (ASRL).

seg-source.mrk: This function supports all valid VISA descriptors, including GPIB, TCP, VXI and Serial Interface instruments (ASRL).

target.mrk: This function supports all valid VISA descriptors, including GPIB, TCP, VXI and Serial Interface instruments (ASRL).

trans-unit.source: A detailed explanation of VISA descriptors is shown in the Remarks section of this function.

seg-source.mrk: A detailed explanation of VISA descriptors is shown in the Remarks section of this function.

target.mrk: A detailed explanation of VISA descriptors is shown in the Remarks section of this function.

trans-unit.source: As a SHORTCUT you can also use a STRING containing the address number (e.g. "20") of a GPIB instrument instead of typing the full descriptor (in that case, "GPIB::20::0")

seg-source.mrk: As a SHORTCUT you can also use a STRING containing the address number (e.g.
"20") of a GPIB instrument instead of typing the full descriptor (in that case, "GPIB::20::0")

target.mrk: As a SHORTCUT you can also use a STRING containing the address number (e.g.
"20") of a GPIB instrument instead of typing the full descriptor (in that case, "GPIB::20::0")

trans-unit.source: * INTEGER -&gr; A VISA session handle is an integer value returned by _viOpen().

seg-source.mrk: * INTEGER -&gr; A VISA session handle is an integer value returned by _viOpen().

target.mrk: * INTEGER -&gr; A VISA session handle is an integer value returned by _viOpen().

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that instead you use _viOpen() and VISA session handles instead of descriptors if you plan to communicate repeteadly with an Instrument or Device, as otherwise each time that you contact the instrument you would incur the overhead of opening and closing the communication link.

seg-source.mrk: It is recommended that instead you use _viOpen() and VISA session handles instead of descriptors if you plan to communicate repeteadly with an Instrument or Device, as otherwise each time that you contact the instrument you would incur the overhead of opening and closing the communication link.

target.mrk: It is recommended that instead you use _viOpen() and VISA session handles instead of descriptors if you plan to communicate repeteadly with an Instrument or Device, as otherwise each time that you contact the instrument you would incur the overhead of opening and closing the communication link.

trans-unit.source: Once you are done using the instrument you must remember to close the link with _viClose().

seg-source.mrk: Once you are done using the instrument you must remember to close the link with _viClose().

target.mrk: Once you are done using the instrument you must remember to close the link with _viClose().

trans-unit.source: A query MUST contain a QUESTION MARK (?)

seg-source.mrk: A query MUST contain a QUESTION MARK (?)

target.mrk: A query MUST contain a QUESTION MARK (?)

trans-unit.source: When the command is a QUERY the function will automatically wait for the instrument's answer (or until the operation times out)

seg-source.mrk: When the command is a QUERY the function will automatically wait for the instrument's answer (or until the operation times out)

target.mrk: When the command is a QUERY the function will automatically wait for the instrument's answer (or until the operation times out)

trans-unit.source: This is mostly important for QUERIES only.

seg-source.mrk: This is mostly important for QUERIES only.

target.mrk: This is mostly important for QUERIES only.

trans-unit.source: If it is not specified the last set timeout will be used. If it was never set before the default timeout (which depends on the VISA implementation) will be used.

seg-source.mrk: If it is not specified the last set timeout will be used.
If it was never set before the default timeout (which depends on the VISA implementation) will be used.

target.mrk: If it is not specified the last set timeout will be used.
If it was never set before the default timeout (which depends on the VISA implementation) will be used.

trans-unit.source: Timeouts can also be set separatelly with the _viSetTimeout() function.

seg-source.mrk: Timeouts can also be set separatelly with the _viSetTimeout() function.

target.mrk: Timeouts can also be set separatelly with the _viSetTimeout() function.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the bus type (GPIB, TCP, etc) the timeout might not be set to the exact value that you request. Instead the closest valid timeout bigger than the one that you requested will be used.

seg-source.mrk: Depending on the bus type (GPIB, TCP, etc) the timeout might not be set to the exact value that you request.
Instead the closest valid timeout bigger than the one that you requested will be used.

target.mrk: Depending on the bus type (GPIB, TCP, etc) the timeout might not be set to the exact value that you request.
Instead the closest valid timeout bigger than the one that you requested will be used.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Control the mode in which the VISA viPrintf is called when $sCommand is not a query.

seg-source.mrk: Control the mode in which the VISA viPrintf is called when $sCommand is not a query.

target.mrk: Control the mode in which the VISA viPrintf is called when $sCommand is not a query.

trans-unit.source: Some instruments and in particular many GPIB cards do not honor the terminator character attribute in those cases an @LF terminator needs to be added.

seg-source.mrk: Some instruments and in particular many GPIB cards do not honor the terminator character attribute in those cases an @LF terminator needs to be added.

target.mrk: Some instruments and in particular many GPIB cards do not honor the terminator character attribute in those cases an @LF terminator needs to be added.

trans-unit.source: As this is the most common case, by default the mode is set to @LF, which appends @LF to the SCPI command you can also set this mode to @CR and @CRLF if your card uses those terminators.

seg-source.mrk: As this is the most common case, by default the mode is set to @LF, which appends @LF to the SCPI command you can also set this mode to @CR and @CRLF if your card uses those terminators.

target.mrk: As this is the most common case, by default the mode is set to @LF, which appends @LF to the SCPI command you can also set this mode to @CR and @CRLF if your card uses those terminators.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to use a terminator, set this parameter to an empty string ("")

seg-source.mrk: If you do not want to use a terminator, set this parameter to an empty string ("")

target.mrk: If you do not want to use a terminator, set this parameter to an empty string ("")

trans-unit.source: Also, some cards support the execution of a "sprintf" on the SCPI string prior to sending it through the VISA interface.

seg-source.mrk: Also, some cards support the execution of a "sprintf" on the SCPI string prior to sending it through the VISA interface.

target.mrk: Also, some cards support the execution of a "sprintf" on the SCPI string prior to sending it through the VISA interface.

trans-unit.source: For those who do, it is possible, by setting this parameter to "str" to "protect" the VISa interface from accidentally applying an escape sequence when a "/" is found within the VISA command string.

seg-source.mrk: For those who do, it is possible, by setting this parameter to "str" to "protect" the VISa interface from accidentally applying an escape sequence when a "/" is found within the VISA command string.

target.mrk: For those who do, it is possible, by setting this parameter to "str" to "protect" the VISa interface from accidentally applying an escape sequence when a "/" is found within the VISA command string.

trans-unit.source: This is normally NOT necessary and should only be set if your GPIB card or instrument require it.

seg-source.mrk: This is normally NOT necessary and should only be set if your GPIB card or instrument require it.

target.mrk: This is normally NOT necessary and should only be set if your GPIB card or instrument require it.

trans-unit.source: Returns a value which depends on whether the command is a QUERY or not and in whether the operation was successful or not.

target.mrk: Returns a value which depends on whether the command is a QUERY or not and in whether the operation was successful or not.

trans-unit.source: * The VISA queries only return the 1st line of the device answer.

target.mrk: * The VISA queries only return the 1st line of the device answer.

trans-unit.source: This is not a problem in most cases, as most devices will always answer with a single line.

trans-unit.source: The GPIB keyword is used for GPIB instruments.

target.mrk: The GPIB keyword is used for GPIB instruments.

trans-unit.source: The TCPIP keyword is used for TCP/IP communication.

target.mrk: The TCPIP keyword is used for TCP/IP communication.

trans-unit.source: The ASRL keyword is used for serial instruments.

target.mrk: The ASRL keyword is used for serial instruments.

trans-unit.source: The PXI keyword is used for PXI instruments.

target.mrk: The PXI keyword is used for PXI instruments.

trans-unit.source: The VXI keyword is used for VXI instruments via either embedded or MXIbus controllers.
